ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I definitely became more confident in my ability to use spanish beyond conversation level. Profesora Jordan is so good at making her studnets feel comfortable and drawing this skill out from them.

I really learned how to articulate my thoughts in writing and also improved my comprehension of Spanish words. I also improved my speaking abilities since the course is conducted in Spanish and the majority of the class was comprised of native speakers.
I learned how to improve my spanish while also learning how to improve my writing in general through different forms of writing.
I got exposure to Latin American short stories, poetry and and other forms of creative writing. We learned different writing styles and techniques

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Profesora Jordan was such a caring and flexible professor when it came to the direction the studnets wanted to take the course. She is so open to feedback that it was amazing. No weaknesses.

The course was nice in that it allowed us artistic liberty, while also forcing us to expand to different and unique forms of writing. It was also nice to read works from other authors. The only part of the course that I struggled with was knowing what exactly we were supposed to be doing since most days we did not follow the syllabus, but we would eventually figure out what we were supposed to be writing or reading, albeit the day of class.

The class is a very collaborative environment. Students review eachothers' feedback and tell them how to improve. Group projects were a great way to learn about different authors together. I really enjoyed the historical aspect as we covered different styles of writing.  Prof. Jordan was incredible and facililated an open dialogue where everyone felt comfortable speaking. She brought fun subjects to the table as well. The course could have a more structured and updated syllabus and rubrics for assignments.

The main strength of this class is professor Jordan. She is an absolutely fantastic professor. The small class was also great as it facilitated class discussion and everyone bought in. As someone whos never written wrote much creative work, I was very comfortable opening up and sharing my work with the class. Everyone was very welcoming and helpful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: 1000%. Any class with Profesora Jordan is a must.

I would recommend this course to other students, I would just make sure that it is clear that it is not a course that benefits you if you are not confident in your grammatical abilities. You will have to work very hard if you are not grammatically up to par, however if you are (or if you work hard) it is a great class that pushes your understanding of the language by making you engage in the reading of poetry and stories that are very unique and complex.
Yes, Professor Jordan is my favorite professor at Yale. It is an extremely fun Spanish course that pushes you to write about subjects you would not have written about in other courses.

Yes, 100%. Unfortunately professor Jordan will not be teaching it again but from what I understand it will be similar. This is a great class to take, it is unique class at Yale and I highly encourage students who have never done anything creative to give it a chance. This is a good class for both native speakers and non native speakers
